alert.note: Alert for Cooke; Montague (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 2:48PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Montague and west central Cooke Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 247 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Muenster, or 16 miles northwest of Gainesville. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Muenster and St. Jo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
